intro: Hieracium scorpioideum, commonly known as the scorpion hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. Hieracium scorpioideum is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
